      • getTypeString

        protected abstract String getTypeString()
        for log purpose, "radio" or "checkbox" is expected.
        Returns:

      • setLabelWrapperIndicatorAttr

        public T setLabelWrapperIndicatorAttr(String attrName)
        By default, there must be a label tag which "for" attribute is specified to the against input element, then this prepare renderer will use a select as "label[for=id]" to retrieve the label element of the input element.
        User can specify a special attribute name to tell this prepare renderer to use selector as "[attrName=id]" to retrieve the against label element which may be a label element with some decorating outer parent elements.
        Parameters:
        attrName -
        Returns:

      • setInputIdByValue

        public T setInputIdByValue(boolean inputIdByValue)
        This prepare renderer will generate new uuids for duplicated input elements but it make test verification difficult. specify true for inputIdByValue will make the generated id fixed to the test value.

        NOTE: This method is for test purpose and we do not recommend to use it in normal rendering logic.

        Parameters:
        inputIdByValue -
        Returns:

      • setDuplicateSelector

        public T setDuplicateSelector(String duplicateSelector)
        This prepare renderer will simply duplicate the continuous input/label pair. If the duplicateSelector is specified, the duplicateSelector will be used to duplicate the target element which is assumed to be containing the actual input/label pair.
        Parameters:
        duplicateSelector -
        Returns:
